meanings.definition: To make something into a commercial product or service for sale.
meanings.sent1: The local bakery decided to commercialise their famous cookie recipe by selling it online.
meanings.sent2: Companies often commercialise new inventions to make them available to the public.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercialising a magic potion to make people fly seemed amusing to the children.
meanings.sent4: She had the ability to commercialise even the most ordinary items, turning them into sought-after products.
meanings.sent5: The process of commercialising the handmade crafts made them lose their personal touch.

meanings.definition: To promote or sell something for profit.
meanings.sent1: The company hired a marketing team to commercialise their latest product launch.
meanings.sent2: In order to succeed in business, one must effectively commercialise their offerings.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercialising a broken toy as a collector's item was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: She could commercialise even the most mundane items, turning them into desirable commodities.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's ability to commercialise any product was truly remarkable.
